cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles SW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf, turning northeast and crossing the southeastern United States toward the Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch currently limited to Alabama-Florida border to Suwannee River, FL (no Georgia coast yet)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings confined to western Cuba, Yucatán, and Florida west coast/Panhandle (no Georgia coast yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast, then inland across Georgia and the Carolinas to the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely but possible minor surge (1-3 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) possible late Wed night–Thu
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along Georgia coast, highest at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 4–6 in. with localized higher totals, causing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; rough seas and dangerous rip currents
